message: Does it make any engineering sense to use ReactJS in conjunction with AngularJS? or is it just geeky? I am ok with geeky, I just want to know if anyone tried it before in some real project and if there were any lessons learned?

data.message: My understanding as I have always seen it presented is that it is an either-or. What parts of Angular you are contemplating to replace with React?

I understand. So you are thinking of implementing the directive function using React DOM manipulation? If so, this sounds somewhat reasonable and not too geeky. However, unless speed is the primary concern, the template-based approach is much a lot more readable.
A prominent Frontend Dev on my team did a thorough analysis on this topic, I forwarded it to your work email.
Why not look at Angular 2.0 it's very close in performance to ReactJS

Mohamed Elsherif it depends on the problem you are trying to solve here. if you are trying to solve the slow rendering issue with Angular then I would for sure recommend you to go for React with Angular for accelerating the time it takes Angular to render it's own directives. I'm working on some tests to see if it's really worth mixing  both libraries or just going for React. 

Also note the price of including both frameworks in terms of adding complexity and debugging who to blame if something goes wrong is it React? or is it Angular? (Just an Advice: Study both of them and stick to one of them).
I tried in an early stage of a project to mix both but it did not make sense so i kept my self to Angular without being distracted , i did not find something so unique with React
